composer.biography: George Frideric Handel was a German-British Baroque composer renowned for his operas, oratorios, anthems, concerti grossi, and organ concertos. Born in Germany, he spent most of his career in London, becoming a British subject in 1727. His most famous work, Messiah, remains one of the most frequently performed choral works in Western music.

catalogSystem.name: Händel-Werke-Verzeichnis
catalogSystem.author: Bernd Baselt
catalogSystem.description: The Händel-Werke-Verzeichnis is a catalogue of Handel's works compiled by Bernd Baselt and published between 1978 and 1986.

operas.name: Operas
operas.description: Italian operas composed primarily for London audiences

oratorios.name: Oratorios
oratorios.description: English oratorios including Messiah and Israel in Egypt

orchestral.name: Orchestral Works
orchestral.description: Concerti grossi, organ concertos, water music, fireworks music

keyboard.name: Keyboard Works
keyboard.description: Suites, fugues, and pieces for harpsichord

works.title: Messiah
works.text: Biblical texts compiled by Charles Jennens
works.instrumentation: SATB soloists, SATB choir, 2 trumpets, timpani, strings, continuo
works.description: Handel's most famous oratorio, telling the story of Jesus Christ

works.title: Water Music Suite No. 1
works.instrumentation: 2 horns, 2 oboes, bassoon, strings, continuo
works.description: Suite composed for King George I's trip on the Thames

works.title: Water Music Suite No. 2
works.instrumentation: 2 trumpets, 2 horns, 2 oboes, bassoon, strings, continuo
works.description: Second suite from the Water Music

works.title: Water Music Suite No. 3
works.instrumentation: Flute, strings, continuo
works.description: Third suite from the Water Music

works.title: Music for the Royal Fireworks
works.instrumentation: 24 oboes, 12 bassoons, 9 trumpets, 9 horns, 3 pairs of timpani, strings
works.description: Celebratory music for fireworks display

works.title: Israel in Egypt
works.instrumentation: SATB soloists, SATB choir, 2 trumpets, timpani, 2 oboes, 2 bassoons, strings, continuo
works.description: Oratorio depicting the Exodus from Egypt

works.title: Saul
works.instrumentation: SATB soloists, SATB choir, carillon, 2 trumpets, timpani, 2 oboes, 2 bassoons, strings, organ
works.description: Dramatic oratorio about King Saul and David

works.title: Judas Maccabaeus
works.instrumentation: SATB soloists, SATB choir, 2 trumpets, timpani, 2 oboes, 2 bassoons, strings, continuo
works.description: Heroic oratorio celebrating the Duke of Cumberland's victory

works.title: Concerto Grosso Op. 6, No. 1
works.instrumentation: Concertino (2 violins, cello), ripieno strings, continuo
works.description: First of the twelve Op. 6 concerti grossi

works.title: Concerto Grosso Op. 6, No. 8
works.instrumentation: Concertino (2 violins, cello), ripieno strings, continuo
works.description: Eighth of the twelve Op. 6 concerti grossi

works.title: Concerto Grosso Op. 6, No. 12
works.instrumentation: Concertino (2 violins, cello), ripieno strings, continuo
works.description: Final of the twelve Op. 6 concerti grossi

works.title: Organ Concerto Op. 4, No. 1
works.instrumentation: Organ solo, 2 oboes, strings, continuo
works.description: First of the Op. 4 organ concertos

works.title: Organ Concerto Op. 4, No. 6
works.instrumentation: Organ solo, strings, continuo
works.description: Last of the Op. 4 organ concertos, includes harp

works.title: Rinaldo
works.description: First Italian opera composed for London stage

works.title: Giulio Cesare (Julius Caesar)
works.description: Opera about Julius Caesar and Cleopatra

works.title: Rodelinda
works.description: Opera about the Lombard queen

works.title: Alcina
works.description: Opera about the sorceress Alcina

works.title: Serse (Xerxes)
works.description: Opera seria with comic elements

works.title: Belshazzar
works.instrumentation: SATB soloists, SATB choir, 2 trumpets, timpani, 2 oboes, 2 bassoons, strings, continuo
works.description: Dramatic oratorio about the fall of Babylon

works.title: Jephtha
works.instrumentation: SATB soloists, SATB choir, 2 trumpets, timpani, 2 oboes, 2 bassoons, strings, organ
works.description: Handel's last oratorio, composed as his eyesight failed

works.title: Suite No. 1 in A major
works.instrumentation: Harpsichord
works.description: First of the Eight Great Suites

works.title: Suite No. 4 in D minor
works.instrumentation: Harpsichord
works.description: Fourth suite, contains the Sarabande with variations

works.title: Suite No. 6 in F-sharp minor
works.instrumentation: Harpsichord

works.title: Suite No. 8 in F minor

works.description: Violin sonata in Italian style

works.title: Trio Sonata in B minor
works.instrumentation: 2 violins, continuo
works.description: Trio sonata from Op. 2

works.title: Zadok the Priest
works.instrumentation: SATB choir, 2 trumpets, timpani, 2 oboes, 2 bassoons, strings, continuo

works.title: The King Shall Rejoice
works.instrumentation: SATB choir, 2 trumpets, timpani, 2 oboes, 2 bassoons, strings, continuo
works.description: Second of the four Coronation Anthems

works.title: Solomon
works.text: Anonymous (based on 1 Kings and Song of Songs)
works.instrumentation: SATB soloists, SATB choir, 2 trumpets, timpani, 2 oboes, 2 bassoons, strings, continuo
works.description: Oratorio about King Solomon
works.famousMovement: Arrival of the Queen of Sheba

bibliography.author: Jonathan Keates
bibliography.title: Handel: The Man and His Music
